text: What do you think about the loss of MIT's 6.001 (SICP) course?
MIT abandoned its legendary 6.001 (Structure and Interpretation of Computer Programs) course and replaced it with 6.00, 6.01 and 6.02 in the new curriculum.
They are AFAIK about Python and robots.
What is your opinion about the loss of SICP and Scheme in computer science education?
Is it a necessary step in the right direction or a bad mistake?

childList.text: 6.001 (Structure and Interpretation of Computer Programs) course
